name: Love-live-group-rank-screen
tagline: This mini project implements a front-end version of a web page that appeared in an anime show.
body:
# Front End Implementation from Screenshots

## What is this?
I made the web page that the girls from the Love Live anime are looking when they want to find out their group’s ranking. I also made this same page responsive, to look like the phone app that Honoka is looking at in Season 1 Episode 11.

## Why?
I wanted to practice implementing ‘comps’. Since I don’t have real comps, I took screenshots of a web page that appeared in an anime show that I enjoy ([Love Live: School Idol Project](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Love_Live!)). 

## How did you get the specs if you didn’t have real comps?
I guessed the site could be made at 960 pixel wide, so I resized the screenshot to show the website at 960 pixels. Using that resized image, I measured everything else on the page with a pixel ruler. I viewed the screenshots in Firefox and used a color picker add on tool to capture the color codes. I could not find exact matching fonts, graphics or icons, so I found ones that fit the ‘spirit’ of the originals. 

The mobile version has a viewing area suitable for an app but not a website (it’s not clear if the site is an app or a webpage); I took more liberties implementing the mobile site than the desktop site. 

## What technology skills were learned/retrieved?
SASS, CSS3,  Responsiveness decisions, HTML5 Boilerplate, Brackets Editor, GIMP

## What are this project’s limitations?
Non-functional (it’s meant to practice front-end)
Fonts are not exact
No stretchiness in mobile

## References
* Love Live Episodes 9, 10
* [Free Ruler Mac tool](http://www.pascal.com/software/freeruler/)
* [colorPicker Firefox add-on](https://addons.mozilla.org/en-US/firefox/addon/colorpicker/?src=api)
* [Brackets](http://brackets.io/)
* [gimp.org](gimp.org)
